items.title: Can the Chiefs get back on track? We stacked every Super Bowl loser that started the next season 0-2
items.summary: The 2025 Chiefs are one of eight NFL teams to lose a Super Bowl and then start the following season at 0-2. Let's rank them and make sense of what's next.

items.title: Colts relatively healthy heading into AFC South matchup at Titans
items.summary: INDIANAPOLIS – As they dive into divisional competition and seek their first 3-0 start since 2009, the Indianapolis Colts appear to have one thing in their favor. Their health. Yes, knock on wood. With Sunday’s AFC South test against the Tennessee Titans in Nashville looming, Shane Steichen offered an encouraging injury update. “No one is [...]

items.title: Indianapolis Colts Injury Report: Tyler Warren, Charvarius Ward Questionable
items.summary: Indianapolis, IN — Indianapolis Colts head coach Shane Steichen revealed to the media following Friday’s practice that no players are slated to miss Indy’s first interdivisional matchup of the 2025-26 season versus the Tennessee Titans. Rookie tight end Tyler Warren and outside cornerback Charvarius Ward (concussion) remain the only players whose availability is still in […]

items.title: Colts do not rule out any players for Week 3 game vs. Tennessee Titans
items.summary: After missing Wednesday's practice with a toe injury, tight end Tyler Warren participated in practice on Thursday and Friday.

items.title: Opponent Preview: The Tennessee Titans
items.summary: The Colts at the moment stand at 2-0 after their home victories vs the Dolphins and Broncos, while their AFC South rival Titans are at 0-2 after a loss by 8 points to the Broncos and a home loss to the Rams by 14 points. The Titans are attempting to rebuild after their 2024 season […]

items.title: Colts-Titans preview: Why Colts aren't reading into records or stats heading into AFC South matchup against winless Titans
items.summary: The 2-0 Colts head to Nashville for their first road game – and first AFC South contest – of the 2025 season on Sunday against the Tennessee Titans at Nissan Stadium. But while the Colts' start to 2025 has been the opposite of the Titans', head coach Shane Steichen and team leaders feel they have this team in a good spot to avoid any sort of letdown game in Week 3.

items.title: Colts’ Matchups to Watch: Week 3 @Titans
items.summary: Colts’ interior offensive line vs. Jeffery Simmons It is no secret that the success of the Titans’ defensive line rests mostly on Simmons’ shoulders. We are talking about a player that already has 10 pressures through two games, and that can take over games entirely on his own. The Colts’ interior offensive line played well […]

items.title: Week 2 Colts Defensive Rankings and Analysis:
items.summary: Each week during the season, I will be walking through the data from the previous Colts game and analyzing the numbers to form a sort of “what happened” narrative, as well as comparing the Colts against all other teams in the league. For a glossary of the stats listed, reference Season Stats. Thanks to Pro Football Reference, NFL.com, Football Outsiders, […]

items.title: Indianapolis Colts Injury Report: WR Downs and DE Latu Return To Practice
items.summary: The Indianapolis Colts today released their Thursday injury report for Week 3 of the NFL season ahead of their Sunday game against the Tennessee Titans. Wide receiver Josh Downs returned to full practice today. Downs missed practice yesterday with an ankle injury but managed a full practice today. Downs looks set to be available to play Sunday […]

items.title: No punts in 2 games? It’s a first for Rigoberto Sanchez and just second time for Colts
items.summary: INDIANAPOLIS – It’s what you call a statistical anomaly. Or. “Wild,’’ offered Rigoberto Sanchez. “Wild. Crazy.’’ He’s the Indianapolis Colts veteran punter whose name doesn’t appear in the NFL stats. Two games. Zero punts. “Never happened before,’’ Sanchez said. Not at California’s Hamilton High School. Or at Hawaii. Or in his first 113 games with [...]

items.title: Colts QB Daniel Jones ‘aced’ last week’s test, but continued consistency remains key
items.summary: Indianapolis Colts quarterback Daniel Jones was in full control during last weekend’s thrilling home win against the Denver Broncos notoriously stingy defense. Jones completed 23 of 34 pass attempts (67.6%) for 316 total passing yards, a passing touchdown, 0 interceptions, and a passer rating of 107.0. It wasn’t just the rock solid stat line that […]

items.title: Colts rookie Tyler Warren named NFL Rookie of the Week for second straight week
items.summary: Indianapolis Colts rookie tight end Tyler Warren was named the NFL’s Pepsi Zero Sugar Rookie of the Week for a second straight week after his performance against the Denver Broncos.  Warren has lived up to the hype as the versatile “Swiss Army Knife” tag that he earned during his All-American campaign at Penn State. The […]

items.title: Colts' offense thriving on early downs, but eyeing improvements in red zone
items.summary: The Colts have been one of the NFL's best offenses to begin the 2025 season largely because of their success on first and second down; that success, though, has come with a recognition that this group collectively needs to be better at scoring touchdowns in the red zone.

items.title: Breaking Down Daniel Jones’ Clutch 3rd-Down Play vs Denver
items.summary: It was another great performance for Daniel Jones, who picked up a key win and has the Colts sitting at the top of the AFC South. Jones’ simple play coupled with key throws in big situations contributed to the Colts’ success on offense and while Jonathan Taylor stole the show in the end, Jones’ good […]

items.title: Colts TE Tyler Warren wins Week 2 NFL Rookie of the Week
items.summary: Warren continued a torrid start to his NFL career with four catches for 79 yards in the Colts' 29-28 win over the Denver Broncos in Week 2.

items.title: Ballard’s quarterback competition is paying early dividends for the Colts
items.summary: When Chris Ballard announced he was going to increase the level of competition in the offseason across the board for the Indianapolis Colts, it sounded encouraging, while at the same time, mostly talk. GMs and coaches talk about competition a lot and at some positions, where there is no true front runner, it makes perfect […]

items.summary: Voice of the Colts Matt Taylor and two-time Colts Pro Bowl tight end Jack Doyle discussed Jonathan Taylor's stellar performance against the Denver Broncos, the running back's relationship with Daniel Jones and much more on this week's episode of The Jack Doyle Show

items.title: Good things happening as Daniel Jones once again paired with elite RB (Jonathan Taylor)
items.summary: INDIANAPOLIS – It’s been just two games, but the cause and effect is undeniable. Give Daniel Jones a viable and vibrant run game, and all things are possible. “It makes a tremendous impact, a running back like that who can hit the big one, hit the home run, who can make it happen late in [...]

items.title: How Colts QB Daniel Jones is handling near-historic level of blitzes to begin 2025 season
items.summary: Jones has been blitzed on 50 dropbacks over his first two games, per Pro Football Focus, which isn't just the highest total in the NFL this season – it's the highest total to begin a season in over a decade.

items.title: 'What it's all about:' Colts players attend fourth annual Colts Unified Flag Classic
items.summary: On Tuesday, the Colts hosted the fourth annual Colts Unified Flag Classic in partnership with Special Olympics Indiana and the Indiana High School Athletic Association.

items.title: Colts’ Jonathan Taylor AFC Offensive Player of the Week
items.summary: INDIANAPOLIS – Jonathan Taylor’s latest breakout game caught the attention of the league office. The Indianapolis Colts’ veteran running back has been named AFC Offensive Player of the Week on the strength of his performance in Sunday’s 29-28 win over Denver. Taylor rushed 25 times for 165 yards and added 50 yards and a touchdown [...]

items.title: Colts RB Jonathan Taylor named AFC Offensive Player of the Week for Week 2
items.summary: Taylor had 25 carries for 165 yards, and two receptions for 50 yards and a touchdown in the Colts' win over the Denver Broncos.

items.summary: Shrader missed his 60-yard field goal attempt on Sunday, but not because he didn't have the strength to get the ball through the uprights.

Less than 24 hours after his Indianapolis Colts chased down Denver 29-28 as time expired on Spencer Shrader’s 45-yard field goal, Steichen conceded he made things more difficult than they needed [...]

items.title: Colts Blue Zone Podcast 424: Colts Top Broncos on Second-Chance Kick
items.summary: The Indianapolis Colts topped the Denver Broncos to open a season 2-0 for the first time since 2009. Thanks to another standout game from Daniel Jones and a strong performance from Jonathan Taylor (plus some mistakes from Denver), Indy gutted out the 29-28 win on a last-second kick from Spencer Shrader. Matt Adams looks at [...]

items.title: Colts' receivers don't back down against Broncos' CB Pat Surtain II, deliver key plays against 2024 Defensive Player of the Year in Week 2 win
items.summary: In throwing for 316 yards in the Colts' 29-28 win over the Denver Broncos in Week 2, quarterback Daniel Jones consistently trusted his pass-catchers against 2024 AP Defensive Player of the Year Pat Surtain II.

items.title: Colts, Spencer Shrader make best of difficult situation; Indy 2-0
items.summary: INDIANAPOLIS — Spencer Shrader was preparing for the toughest kick of his young NFL life. And Shane Steichen seemed intent on making it as difficult as possible. With time winding down Sunday at a raucous Lucas Oil Stadium, the Indianapolis Colts trailed Denver, 28-26. But they were driving. First-and-10 at the Broncos’ 43-yard line, one [...]

items.title: Daniel Jones, Colts' offense pass major test with efficient, explosive showing in win over stingy Broncos defense
items.summary: Daniel Jones completed 23 of 34 passes for 316 yards with a passing and rushing touchdown in the Colts' 29-28 Week 2 win over the Denver Broncos on Sunday at Lucas Oil Stadium.

items.title: How faith and discipline set up Spencer Shrader's game-winning field goal: 'You just have to trust'
items.summary: Shrader nailed a 45-yard field goal – his fifth of the game – to secure the Colts' win over the Broncos on Sunday.

items.title: Shrader's kick propels Colts to 29-28 win and 2-0 start
items.summary: INDIANAPOLIS — Spencer Shrader kicked a 45-yard, game-winning field goal as time expired to lift the Indianapolis Colts to a 29-28 win over the Denver Broncos on Sunday afternoon. The Colts are now 2-0 for the first time since 2009. Shrader missed a 60-yard attempt before his 45-yarder, but the Broncos were flagged for leverage. [...]

items.title: Colts rally for comeback win vs. Broncos
items.summary: The Colts took down the Broncos 29-28 on a last-second field goal from Spencer Shrader.

items.title: Colts announce 6 inactive players for Week 2 game vs. Denver Broncos

items.title: Practice notebook: Colts' cornerback depth comes into focus with Charvarius Ward Sr. in concussion protocol, Jaylon Jones out
items.summary: Neither Ward nor Jones practiced Thursday – head coach Shane Steichen said Jones would be out for a while – meaning the Colts may lean on three newcomers at corner to step in for Sunday's game against the Denver Broncos.

items.title: The Colts are leaning into versatility on offense in 2025 with a sneaky undercurrent to it
items.summary: In Week 1, seven Colts players caught a pass – but 17 of Daniel Jones' 29 targets went to tight end Tyler Warren and Michael Pittman Jr.

items.title: 9 years into NFL career, Kenny Moore II is still building his legacy
items.summary: Kenny Moore II, as a 16-year-old, quit football. He was coaxed back a day later. Over a decade later, he's still playing, and still has plenty more to accomplish.
